summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of the alley in Block Twenty (20), of an Addition to the Town (now City) of Seattle, as laid off on the claims C. D. Boren, A. A. Denny and H. L. Yesler, being the alley from Madison Street to Spring Street, between Third Avenue and Fourth Avenue, by grading and paving the same with vitrified brick, laid upon a proper concrete foundation, and providing for the necessary surface drainage, in accordance with Resolution No. 1042 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Immediate Payment," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
